# practica2pinguinos

The goal of practica2pinguinos is to …

## Installation

You can install the development version of practica2pinguinos from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("Kiaramanacasa/practica2pinguinos")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

``` r
library(practica2pinguinos)
## basic example code
```

What is special about using `README.Rmd` instead of just `README.md`?
You can include R chunks like so:

``` r
summary(cars)
#>      speed           dist       
#>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
#>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
#>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
#>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
#>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
#>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
```

You’ll still need to render `README.Rmd` regularly, to keep `README.md`
up-to-date. `devtools::build_readme()` is handy for this.

You can also embed plots, for example:

![](reference/figures/README-pressure-1.png)

In that case, don’t forget to commit and push the resulting figure
files, so they display on GitHub and CRAN.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`calcular_indice_masa_corporal()`](https://kiaramanacasa.github.io/practica2pinguinos/reference/calcular_indice_masa_corporal.md)
  : Calculo del indice de masa corporal (IMC)
- [`convertir_pulgadas_a_centimetros()`](https://kiaramanacasa.github.io/practica2pinguinos/reference/convertir_pulgadas_a_centimetros.md)
  : Convertir pulgadas a centimetros
- [`pinguinos_demo`](https://kiaramanacasa.github.io/practica2pinguinos/reference/pinguinos_demo.md)
  : Datos de pingüinos de ejemplo
